To amend the National Trails System Act to designate the Navajo Long Walk to Bosque Redondo as a national historic trail.

To amend the National Trails System Act to designate the route in Arizona and New Mexico which the Navajo and Mescalero Apache Indian tribes were forced to walk in 1863 and 1864, for study for potential addition to the National Trails System.

bill.summary: 10/2/2001--Passed House amended. Long Walk National Historic Trail Study Act - Amends the National Trails System Act to require study, for potential designation as a national historic trail, of the Long Walk Trail, a series of routes which the Navajo and Mescalero Apache Indian tribes were forced to walk beginning in the fall of 1863 as a result of their removal by the U.S. Government from their ancestral lands, generally located within a corridor extending through portions of Canyon de Chelley, Arizona, and Albuquerque, Canyon Blanco, Anton Chico, Canyon Piedra Pintado, and Fort Sumner, New Mexico.
